verbs.description: so many animals [V: will] go extinct in the next 50 years that it will take earth at least 3 million years to recover a study has found mammals are facing high rates of extinction as humans destroy their habitats in a new study danish researchers conclude that so many mammal species will go extinct in the next 50 years that the planet evolutionary diversity wo n't recover for at least 3 million years conservation of nature pnas jens christian svenning aarhus university professor megafauna international union jens - christian svenning matt davis 50 years earth 3 million years denmark matt davis comedian
